intro: Sonchus zacinthoides, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and serrated, alternate leaves. Its vibrant purple flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting a variety of pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a range of light conditions.
